result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick P Haynes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick P Haynes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick P Haynes was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Patrick P Haynes was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Patrick P Haynes was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling Dunn County Case #15CF321 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Donald J. Schwab DF: Patrick P Haynes appeared. Case called at   Includes 15CF346, Eau Claire County case 15CF925, Chippewa County Case 15CF425, Dunn County 15CF321. Atty's are jointly waiving a PSI. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1, 2  in 15CF346 and guilty to Dunn County case Ct. 1 in 15CF321. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1, 2 in 15CF346 in St. Croix County Case  and guilty of Ct. 1 in Dunn County case 15CF321. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses Ct 3-6 in 15CF346 St. Croix County Case with DE acknowledging these counts for the purpose of restitution. Court reads in and dismisses Ct. 1 in Eau Claire County Case 15CF925 and dismisses 2,3 in Eau Claire County Case. Court reads in and dismisses Ct. 1 in Chippewa Falls Case 15CF425 and dismisses 2, 3 in Chippewa Falls Case. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H on all cases. 
4 years probation with conditions:
 Court notes 161 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
 Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Restitution of $141.50 on Chippewa Falls case and $330.00 on the Dunn County case. Court reserves on the other 2 cases at this time. 
  Atty.'s have 10 days to address restitution. 
- Costs on all counts
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to  participate in any an all treatment programs
- DE to maintain mental health program
- DE to participate in MRT. 
- DE to maintain employment. 
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  any storage businesses where DE does not have a unit.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.

Court orders any other restitution be joint and several.
DE to sign up for probation today.
